sentences.en: Allen died in 1964, at the age of 58, and Burns was distraught.
sentences.cn: 艾伦于1964年病逝, 享年58岁.伯恩斯一度神情沮丧.

sentences.en: Another is distraught after an offer of a permanent job was withdrawn.
sentences.cn: 另一名妇女,在申请一份长久工作被拒后,心情烦乱.

sentences.en: Distraught with grief, I signed away my rights to the property.
sentences.cn: 因悲伤我在恍惚中签字让出了我的财产权.

sentences.en: Dorothy is too distraught to attend the ceremony herself.
sentences.cn: 多萝西心烦意乱,无法出席哥哥的婚礼.
他显得面容憔悴、心神不宁.

sentences.en: Here he was not surprised to meet Stener just coming out, looking very pale and distraught.
sentences.cn: 不出他所料,他碰见斯坦纳正走出来, 面色苍白,精神恍惚.

sentences.en: His distraught parents were being comforted by relatives.
sentences.cn: 亲戚们正在安慰他那心急如焚的父母。

sentences.en: I was distraught and let out a bellow of tearful rage.
sentences.cn: 我心烦意乱，流着眼泪发了一通火。

sentences.en: If you see a guy looking distraught while comparing the active ingredients of various toothpastes, look again. That might be me.
sentences.cn: 如果你看到一个抓狂的家伙正在比较不同牙膏的活性成分，仔细看一眼，那说不定就是我。

sentences.en: It was Wu Chih - sheng. He was looking rather distraught, but managed to smile at her.
sentences.cn: 这是吴芝生, 脸色虽然很难看, 嘴角上却还带着微笑.

sentences.en: One Republican committee chairman was plainly distraught when he told a White House aide that he didn’t want to vote for impeachment but he would lose his chairmanship if he voted against it.
sentences.cn: 一个任委员会主席的共和党人简直就是发了狂，他对一名白宫助手说，他并不想投票支持弹劾，但如果他投反对票就会失去主席的职位。

sentences.en: Relatives are tonight comforting the distraught parents.
sentences.cn: 亲戚们今晚都在安慰这对忧心如焚的父母。

sentences.en: She has been distraught since recently breaking up with her boyfriend.
sentences.cn: 她真盼望她能改善情况.
听上去她完全心慌意乱.
她担心得几乎要发疯了.

sentences.en: Tony is shot in revenge, and Maria is left distraught.
sentences.cn: 在《西区故事》中,托尼被复仇者射杀, 留下发疯的玛丽亚.

sentences.en: Upset: In a state of emotional or mental distress; distraught.
sentences.cn: 心烦意乱的: 情绪或精神上苦恼的状态; 发狂的.

sentences.en: Weeks after the accident she remained distraught.
sentences.cn: 事故过去几周了,可她仍是心神不安.

trans.tran_cn: 心神错乱的，几乎发狂的，忧心如焚的
trans.tran_en: so upset and worried that you cannot think clearly
